content.description: start up some chossy rock for a few bolts then move slightly right using a corner and face holds to the right.  Squeeze your way through the ok holds and bad feet.  A giant rest half way up give you plenty of time to recover for the fun pod climbing up high
content.protection: lots and lots of bolts, be sure to clip the right bolts at the large rest ledge.
content.location: middle of the Solstice Wall, starts on 2 shiny hangers

content.description: A very unique route for the fins. Climbs on flake features and rad underclings. DO IT!
content.location: This is the wall’s namesake route and is the furthest right route on the wall.

content.description: An extension of Huck You. After the anchor there is essentially no resting until the hard climbing is over. Many long and demanding moves in a row, just keep coming. A pounce-dyno is the first cruxy section followed by worsening holds to a crap rest. From here a complex crux with a left hand side pull and a terribly small right hand chip takes you then leftward to reach the arete. A very engaging and run out crux (albeit much easier) guards the anchor. So good.
Nice short route with big moves on good holds.
content.protection: 6 bolts to an anchor with biners on it.
content.location: Huck You is the third line in from the right side of the wall. It is one of the shorter routes on the wall and ends below half height.

content.description:
Enter The Dragon is a striking crack line on the left side of the Solstice Wall.

Start on the same rail feature as the "Blue Tape Route". Climb on crimps and pockets past four bolts to a ledge and rest. The rest of the route is gear protected.

Climb the obvious seam either straight in or via a compression sequence. Continuous climbing leads to a series of boulder problem separated by rests.

The fight doesn't end until you clip the chains. The gear on the route is tricky.
content.protection: Four bolts and plentiful small cams and stoppers. A #1 camalot is also useful. Offset cams can be helpful too.
content.location: The left of two cracks on the left side of the Solstice Wall.

content.description: Start with some easy moves along the flake heading left then into the broken arete.  It gets a little harder here but there's a nice jug at the last bolt.
content.location: Farthest left route on the wall.  It starts at the base of the left trending flake
